Package memory

A two-players game : players must remember the value of hidden cards, and find the identical pairs.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ActionMemory Following Zwick and Patterson analysis, there are only three different useful actions : Flip two already known cards.
MemoryBoard This version of the Memory game tries to maximize the probability to win the game.
MemoryBoardZP The version studied by Zwick and Patterson,where they try to maximize the number of cards.
MemoryState A state for the Memory game gathers a lot of information : The list of known cards (with links to find their position on the board).
Position A auxiliary class to handle pairs of integers.
 

Package memory Description

A two-players game : players must remember the value of hidden cards, and find the identical pairs.
There is an optimal strategy, depending on the number of cards. see Zwick and Patterson paper.
